description.narrative:
UN Women Country Office in Colombia has submitted a proposal to the Embassy of Sweden in Bogotá for funding of 49 MSEK to support the implementation of the Country’s Strategic Note in Colombia during the period June 1st, 2018 – December 31st, 2021.
The overall objective of the intervention is to contribute to strengthen the political and economic empowerment of women and their right to a life free from violence, both in the context of the conflict as well as beyond it, in a way that this supports the construction of stable and sustainable peace. In order to achieve this, UN Women will focus during this period in the following areas: 1) Women lead and participate in decision making at all levels; 2) Women, particularly the poorest and most excluded are economically empowered by and benefit from development; 3) Women and girls live a life free of violence; 4) Peace and security, and humanitarian action are shaped by women leadership and participation.

UN Women:s kontor i Colombia har överlämnat ett förslag till Sveriges Ambassad i Bogotá om finansiering på 49 MSEK för att stödja implementeringen av det Landspecifika Strategiska Dokumentet i Colombia (Strategic Note Colombia) under perioden den 1 juni 2018 – 31 december 2021.
Det övergripande syftet med insatsen är att stärka den politiska och ekonomiska egenmakten av kvinnor och deras rätt till ett liv fritt från våld, både i kontexten av konflikt likväl som bortom detta, på ett sätt som stödjer byggandet av en varaktig och hållbar fred. I avsikt att uppnå detta, kommer UN Women under denna period att fokusera på följande områden: 1) Kvinnor leder och medverkar i beslutstagande på alla nivåer; 2) Kvinnor, särskilt de fattigaste och mest exkluderade, åstadkommer ekonomisk egenmakt genom och med fördel av utveckling; 3) Kvinnor och flickor lever ett liv fritt från våld; 4) Fred och säkerhet, och humanitära aktioner är formade av kvinnligt ledarskap och deltagande.

participating-org.narrative: UNWOMEN/United Nations Entity for Gender Equality and the Empowerment of Women
United Nations Entity for Gender Equality and the Empowerment of Women

tag.narrative: 5.1 - Avskaffa alla former av diskriminering av alla kvinnor och flickor överallt
5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.
5.c - Adopt and strengthen sound policies and enforceable legislation for the promotion of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls at all levels.
5.c - Anta och stärka välgrundad politik och genomförbar lagstiftning för att främja jämställdhet och öka alla kvinnors och flickors egenmakt på alla nivåer

title.narrative: Decision on support to UN Women Colombia 2018-2021

description.narrative: UN Women's activities during 2019 were implemented within the context of: 1) The approval of the Colombian national government's Development Plan, which includes a specific chapter on gender equality; 2) Increased threats and assassinations of social leaders and human rights defenders; 3) Local elections with the following results for women: 15% mayors, 6% governors (15% in 2015), representing a stagnation in comparison with previous years; 4) continued humanitarian crisis because of the migratory flows from Venezuela. Sweden is the only bilateral donor in Colombia to provide non-ear marked support to UN Women's Strategic Note. Other donors provide program or project support, such as: USAID, Norway, Koica; and some projects are being funded through the Peace Building Fund, The UN-Multipartner Trust Fund in Colombia, among others. The resources received as a non-ear marked support are distributed by UN Women in three areas, and the area "Women and girls live a life free of violence", is funded totally with resources from USAID. The synergies of UN Women's mandate: normative support, UN System coordination, and operational activities during 2019 are seen in the work undertaken with the Government's National Development Plan approved in May 2019 and gender-responsive budgeting for 2020; the strengthening of gender national statistics; the support for a more sensitive gender equality agenda in the Congress; the support to the creation of the National Care System; the support to the implementation of a gender perspective in the Transitional Justice System; the monitoring of the implementation of the gender provisions in the Peace Agreement together with the International Accompaniment. Results are seen at different levels strengthening governmental entities and women's organizations, both at the local and national level. Some examples of key results achieved during 2019 are : 1. Women lead, participate in and benefit equally from governance systems Technical assistance to the National Planning Department (DNP) and the Congress contributed to the incorporation of one chapter on gender equity in the National Development Plan in 2019. This chapter has a comprehensive vision for the gender equality agenda, rural women, women in peacebuilding, labor market, political sphere, a life free of violence, strengthening the national gender machinery (Presidential Office for Women's Equity - CPEM) and the recognition of care work. The program "Women Count" funded by Sida's Global Funds is being implemented in Colombia through a strategic alliance with the National Statistics Department (DANE), to make visible gender gaps and women's situation in the labor market, and care work. Statistical information has been released on care work and women's economic empowerment and has been an important input for decision making. Technical assistance was also given to the Congress (Women's Caucus) and the National Planning Department on gender budgeting. Article 223 of the National Development Plan is a mandatory gender-responsive planning and budgeting mechanism which requests budget planners to specify the allocations for gender equality in national entities. A Women Elected Summit was held in December 2019 with the participation of new elected women in local authorities to promote coordination among them, and provide them with technical assistance for their work. This is part of UN Women's work in strengthening local institutions, gender machineries and women's participation in local governance. 2. Women have income security, decent work and economic autonomy A statistical bulletin was developed together with DANE on "Women's Economic Empowerment in Colombia", promoting the visibility of specific indicators and showing the advances and the challenges in gender gaps. An example at the local level is the implementation of a pilot public gender-budgeting and planning experience in Villavicencio (Meta department); and work with local gender entities and the new elected local authorities. Technical assistance and analysis on the following data sources was given by UN Women to DANE: 1) Population and Housing Census 2018, 2) Large Integrated Household Survey 2018, and 3) National Time Use Survey. These statistics target specifically two SDG indicators: 8.5.1 Unemployment rate and gender percentage gap, and 1.2.1 Evolution of the Incidence of monetary poverty and femininity index in poor households. In alliance with the international organization Promundo, support was given to the National Planning Department on masculinities as an input for the elaboration of the National Care System. 3. All women and girls live a life free from all forms of violence This is reported separately as a special program on violence against women is funded with resources from USAID. Nevertheless, it can be mentioned that in the department of Nariño, support has been given to women's social organizations working for the rights of girls, women, mainly victims of sexual violence, indigenous and afrocolombian women from rural areas, promoting equality and social transformation. The project has allowed them to form the Network of Human Rights Defenders, “Godmothers Weavers of Peace”, for the protection and dignification of their work. 4. Women and girls contribute and have greater influence in building sustainable peace and resilience and benefit equally from prevention of natural disasters and conflicts and from humanitarian action. Un Women has contributed to strengthen women's proposals and their active participation in peacebuilding activities in five prioritized regions: Cauca, Nariño, Antioquia, Chocó and Meta. Through technical assistance given to the organizations, we have contributed to make visible their proposals, challenges and needs to the local and national public entities. The gender perspective within the Integral System for Truth, Justice and Reparation has been strengthened through the Gender groups within the Special Jurisdiction for Peace (JEP) and the Truth Commission. Support has also been given to women's organizations for their participation and presentation of approximately 600 cases and testimonies to the Truth Commission and to the JEP in 2019. A second report on the implementation of the gender commitments in the Peace Agreement was launched in December 2019, by UN Women, Sweden, and the Women's Democratic Federation (FDIM), in alliance with the Kroc Institute. The report was presented to the Government, the FARC, the international community and women's organizations. The report highlights the advances made in the implementatoion of commitments within the rural reform, pilot projects, inclusion of gender measures in the reincorporation of women former combatants and in the implementation of the gender approach in the Integral System for Truth, Justice, and Reparation. However, up to August 2019, only 8% of the gender commitments were completed and 42% had not been initiated. Issues to be addressed urgently are related to programs in areas most affected by the conflict, such as the program for the sustitution of illicit crops (PNIS), and the territorial development plans; security guarantees for women and LGBT groups in the territories; and the elimination of barriers for women former combatant's participation in the political, economic and social activities of reincorporation.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
